thread.title: Oil Closes at Three-Year High

author: Christopher Alessi
title: Oil Closes at Three-Year High
text:
Oil prices closed at a fresh three-year high on Friday as the International Energy Agency predicted robust oil demand for the full year and as geopolitical risks to supply remained.
Light, sweet crude for May delivery settled up 32 cents, or 0.5%, to $67.39 a barrel on the New York Mercantile Exchange, the highest level since December 2014. Brent, the global benchmark, advanced 56 cents, or 0.8%, to $72.58 a barrel.
